column4: uplink: I really recommend using a text editor to begin with and use g++ from the cli to compile

uplink: (i am sure i will get yelled at for this...) and ide has a lot of shortcuts and other things to make a developers life easier. you should likely be working from scratch if you are just beginning
uplink: the default text editor you recieved with ubuntu will do syntax highlighting for c++, then you can compile from the command line
